required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Trial Enzyme Application Targeting Venous Leg Ulcers
clinical_study.official_title: An Open Label, Multiple Ascending Dose Study of the Safety, Tolerability and Bio-effect of Aurase for Wound Debridement in Patients With Venous Leg Ulcers.

brief_summary.textblock: This is an open-label, first-in-human (Phase IIa) study designed to assess the safety (and efficacy) of Aurase Wound Gel, an enzymatic debridement product, intended for topical application to sloughy venous leg ulcers (VLU).

detailed_description.textblock: The study has been designed as a dose escalation study, and will serially explore increasing concentrations of the Aurase enzyme in a relevant patient population. Five cohorts (of 10 patients each, except cohort 1 with 5 patients), will receive standard of care supplemented with increasing concentrations of Aurase and will be assessed for clinical tolerability at the wound site, systemic safety and efficacy (extent of wound debridement) over a period of 4 weeks. Patients will receive a total of 12 doses of Aurase Wound Gel. At the end of the study, patients will revert to standard of care only.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Cohort study design with each cohort having an ascending dose of Aurase wound gel. At the time of initiation, 5 sequential cohorts are planned.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of treatment emergent Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From the time of signing informed consent up to the last visit (Day 29)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in study wound pain burden from baseline measured by Numerical Rating Scale (NRS)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dosing and post-dose at day 1 (baseline) through to day 29 (end of study)
primary_outcome.description: Subject will be asked to describe the level of wound pain on a scale of 1-10: 1 being no pain, 10 being worst imaginable pain

primary_outcome.measure: Grading of clinical signs of wound inflammation
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dosing and Post-dose at day 1 (baseline) through to day 29 (end of study)
primary_outcome.description: 5-point ordinal grading scale (1 [none] to 5 [severe] ) of wound erythema, oedema made by clinical assessor by Visual Assessment (VA)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in study wound itch burden from baseline measured by Numerical Rating Scale (NRS)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose at day 1 (baseline) through to day 29 (end of study)
primary_outcome.description: Subject will be asked to describe the level of wound itch on a scale of 1-10: 1 being no itch, 10 being worst imaginable itch

primary_outcome.measure: Grading of clinical signs of wound infection
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (baseline) through to day 29 (end of study)
primary_outcome.description: 5-point ordinal grading scale (1 [none] to 5 [severe] ) of wound exudate and induration or grading of presence/absence of wound bleeding and infection made by clinical assessor by Visual Assessment (VA)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in surface area of wound size compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (baseline) through to day 29 (end of study)
Day 1 (baseline) through to day 29 (end of study)
secondary_outcome.description: Determination of 100% debridement made by clinical assessor upon assessment of wound at each study visit

secondary_outcome.measure: Systemic absorption of Aurase enzyme assessed through pharmacokinetic profiling of blood samples
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and Post dose at day 1 (baseline) and day 29 (end of study) or early termination visit (if applicable)

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of the presence of antibodies to Aurase in plasma (Anti-Drug Antibody [ADA] activity) through applicable laboratory analysis of blood samples
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (Baseline) and day 29 (end of study) or early termination visit (if applicable)

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of systemic clotting factors in plasma
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0 (Screening), day 1 (Baseline), day 8 and day 29 (end of study) or early termination visit (if applicable)
secondary_outcome.description: Activated partial thromboplastin time (APTT)/ prothrombin time (PT)/Fibrinogen plasma concentrations determined through laboratory analysis of blood samples

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in surface area of granulation tissue from baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (baseline) through to day 29 (end of study)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in surface area of devitalised tissue (slough, eschar) compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (baseline) through to day 29 (end of study)

arm_group.description: Cohort 1: Aurase wound gel x0 dose concentration
Cohort 2: Aurase wound gel x1 dose concentration
Cohort 3: Aurase wound gel X2.5 dose concentration
Cohort 4: Aurase wound gel X5 dose concentration
Cohort 5: Aurase wound gel X9 dose concentration

intervention.description: Aurase Wound Gel is reconstituted from Aurase Component A (a hydrogel) and Aurase Component B (stabilised solutions of Aurase enzyme). By diluting different strengths of Aurase Component B with Component A, specific concentrations of Aurase Wound Gels with differing Aurase contents are yielded.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female patients aged 18 years and older at screening
- Patients with at least one defined Venous Leg Ulcer (VLU) suitable for treatment that is no smaller than 2cm2 but no larger than 50cm2
- Presence of slough and/or eschar within the reference ulcer suitable for debridement therapy
- Confirmed, clinically diagnosed VLU (30 days or more) which has been present for less than 2 years
- Willing and able to attend and comply with study visits and study related activities
Exclusion Criteria:
- Diabetic Foot Ulcer
- A clinical history of a bleeding disorder including haemophilia, purpura, or thrombocytopenia
- Current or history of use of anti-thrombotic therapy less than 7 days prior to screening.
- Stage 4 or 5 chronic kidney disease, defined as estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) less than or equal to 30 mL/min
- Reference ulcer has active infection or florid oedema at screening
- Oral or intravenous antibiotics for any indication within 72 hours of screening
- Reference ulcer has exposed tendons, ligaments, muscle, or bone
- Active osteomyelitis, cellulitis or gangrene in either leg
- Patients with amputation above a trans metatarsal amputation (TMA) in the target leg
- Planned vascular surgery, angioplasty, or thrombolysis procedures within the study period, or 4 weeks before screening
